title: Which Characters Have the Best Playerbase?
body:
So I was having a conversation today about work place dynamics with a fellow manager and he brought up the comment of" Everyone's character determines how they handle others". This instantly made me think of League because of the way it was phrased. 

The question I present to you all is which characters tend to have the most understanding, caring and enjoyable to play with people from your experience? I already know there are going to be people who bring up the Yas, Zed, Riven mains as the worst but I want to hear about experiences with people who play a certain champion.

Example: I have found that people who play {{champion:83}} tend to be pretty reserved in game but are very nice when they do communicate. I have also found that people who play {{champion:50}}  have a similar demeanor.

{{sticker:galio-happy}} 

Thanks for reading!

{{champion:36}} surprisingly. They seem the most inclined to just all chat the lane away.

Just about every champion sub-community has players who will help you. Though I would imagine the larger the sub-community, the greater the likelihood of being flamed for not meeting their "play-level" standards.

Since Shaco was my main. I just got lucky enough where the sub-community forewarned me to stay calm at all times because how stressful jungling/counter-jungling/ganking with Shaco will be. It's a lot of responsibility for one player to take on. Especially when you have teammates who either A) Don't feel the need to respond to **anything** you ask of them or B) They just downright refuse to cooperate with anything you do.
